column1:
FREQUENCY CHART
Reading Language Arts - Grade 6

column2: Topic
column5: Skill

column2: Listen Actively, Ask Questions, and Respond Appropriately
column5: Listen actively, ask clarifying questions, and respond appropriately.

column2: Follow and Give Oral Instructions
column5: Follow and give oral instructions.

column2: Give an Organized Presentation, and Communicate Ideas Effectively
column5: Give an organized presentation, and communicate ideas effectively.

column2: Participate in Student-Led Discussions
column5: Participate in student-led discussions.

column2: Use Print and Digital Resources to Determine Word Meanings
column5: Use a dictionary entry to determine a word's meaning in context.

column2: Use Context to Determine Word Meanings
column5: Use the context to determine a word's meaning.
Select words from the text that help the reader understand a word's meaning.

column2: Use Word Parts to Determine Word Meanings
column5: Use Latin roots to determine a word's meaning.
Identify a word that contains a Latin root.

column2: Read Grade-Level Texts with Fluency and Comprehension
column5: Read grade-level texts with fluency and comprehension.
Adjust fluency based on the reading purpose.

column2: Read Independently for Sustained Periods of Time
column5: Read grade-appropriate texts independently for a sustained period of time.

column2: Topic
column5: Skill

column2: Set a Purpose for Reading and Monitor Comprehension
column5: Read grade-level texts with fluency and comprehension.
Adjust fluency based on the reading purpose.
Establish a purpose for reading.
Monitor comprehension and make adjustments.
Interact with sources (notetaking, annotating, freewriting, or illustrating).

column2: Make Predictions and Ask Questions While Reading
column5: Generate questions before, during, and after reading.
Make a prediction.

column2: Make Connections and Create Mental Images While Reading
column5: Create mental images while reading.
Make a personal connection to the text.
Determine the similarities between texts.
Determine the differences between texts.
Make a connection to society.

column2: Use Resources, Context, and Word Parts to Determine Word Meanings
column5: Use a dictionary entry to determine a word's meaning in context.
Use the context to determine a word's meaning.
Select words from the text that help the reader understand a word's meaning.
Use Latin roots to determine a word's meaning.
Identify a word that contains a Latin root.

column2: Make Inferences and Use Evidence to Support Understanding
column5: Make an inference about a character, narrator, or speaker based on text evidence.
Make an inference about an idea or event based on text evidence.
Make an inference about the cause or reason why based on text evidence.
Make an inference about the author's purpose.
Draw a conclusion based on text evidence.
Make a generalization based on text evidence.
Use text evidence to support an idea or inference.

column2: Determine Key Ideas and Details
column5: Determine a key idea in the text.
Select the details that support a key idea.
Recall important details from the text.

column2: Writing Complete Sentences Using Independent Clauses
column5: Edit for complete sentences.
Edit for subject-verb agreement.

column2: Close Reading: Read, Discuss, and Respond to Texts
column5: Review

column2: Respond in Writing to Questions About Texts
column5: Write a response that demonstrates an understanding of the text.
Use text evidence to support an appropriate response.
Respond using newly acquired vocabulary as appropriate.
Discuss and write about the explicit or implicit meanings of text.
Respond using appropriate vocabulary, tone, and voice.
Reflect on and adjust responses as new evidence is presented.
Revise a draft.
Edit a draft using standard English conventions.
